SEARCH
Package spaceInvaders.Controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
spaceInvaders.Controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGameController
public class GameController extends Object implements IGameController
The GameController class is part of the spaceInvaders.Controller package. It acts as a mediator between the game model and view, handling game logic and user input. This class is responsible for updating the game state, processing player and enemy actions, and ensuring that the game view is consistently updated to reflect the current state of the game. Example usage: IGameModel model = new GameModel(); IGameView view = new GameView(); IGameController controller = new GameController(model, view); controller.startGame();
Version:
1.0
Author:
MD Amanullah

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController(IGameModel model, IGameView view)
      Constructor to initialize the GameController with a specific game model and view. Sets the initial game state to START_SCREEN.
      Parameters:
      model - The game model to be used for game logic.
      view - The game view to be used for rendering.

  • Method Details

    • validateMoveInputs

      private void validateMoveInputs(int dx, int dy) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Validates the movement inputs for the player and enemy. Ensures that the movement deltas are within the allowed range.
      Parameters:
      dx - The delta in the x-direction, should be -1, 0, or 1.
      dy - The delta in the y-direction, should be -1, 0, or 1.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If either dx or dy is outside the range of -1 to 1.

    • movePlayer

      public void movePlayer(int dx, int dy)
      Moves the player in the game based on the input directions. This method is responsible for updating the player's position in response to user input, within the constraints of the game's rules (e.g., the game must be running and not over).
      Specified by:
      movePlayer in interface IGameController
      Parameters:
      dx - The change in the x-direction (-1 for left, 1 for right, 0 for no horizontal movement).
      dy - The change in the y-direction (-1 for up, 1 for down, 0 for no vertical movement).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided movement deltas are invalid (outside the range of -1 to 1).

    • moveEnemy

      public void moveEnemy(int dx, int dy)
      Moves the enemy based on specified directions. This method is similar to movePlayer but controls the movement of the enemy character. The method checks if the game is running and not over before allowing the enemy to move.
      Specified by:
      moveEnemy in interface IGameController
      Parameters:
      dx - The change in the x-direction (-1, 0, or 1).
      dy - The change in the y-direction (-1, 0, or 1).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided movement deltas are invalid.

    • shootBullet

      public void shootBullet()
      Triggers the player to shoot a bullet. This method is responsible for handling the player's shooting action within the game. The player can shoot only if the game is currently running and not over.
      Specified by:
      shootBullet in interface IGameController

    • shootEnemyBullet

      public void shootEnemyBullet()
      Triggers the enemy to shoot a bullet. This action is only allowed if the game is running and not over.
      Specified by:
      shootEnemyBullet in interface IGameController

    • setGameState

      public void setGameState(GameState state)

      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      state - The new state to set the game to.

    • handleKeyPress

      public void handleKeyPress(char key, int keyCode)
      Handles key press events to control game functionality. This includes starting the game, pausing/resuming, and controlling player and enemy actions.
      Specified by:
      handleKeyPress in interface IGameController
      Parameters:

    • handleGameplayKeys

      Parameters:

      keyCode - The keycode of the key pressed.

    • togglePause

      private void togglePause()
      Toggles the game state between paused and running. If the game is running, it will be paused; if paused, it will resume.

    • handleMovementAndShooting

      private void handleMovementAndShooting(char key, int keyCode)
      Handles player movement and shooting based on key presses. It interprets the key codes for movement (up, down, left, right) and shooting (spacebar).
      Parameters:
      key - The character of the key pressed.
      keyCode - The keycode of the key pressed.

    • isGameRunning

      public boolean isGameRunning()
      Checks if the game is currently running. This is used to determine the active state of the game.
      Specified by:

      Returns:
      true if the game is running, false otherwise.

    • isGamePaused

      public boolean isGamePaused()

      Specified by:

      Returns:
      true if the game is paused, false otherwise.

    • isStartScreen

      Specified by:

      Returns:

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Converts the state of the GameController to a string representation. This method is particularly useful for debugging, providing a quick snapshot of the controller's current state.
